bibl.seg: Marcello Valente, Timocrate di Rodi e l'oro di Farnabazo: per una cronologia delle Elleniche di Ossirinco.
Minima Epigraphica et Papyrologica 12-15 (2009-2012) fasc. 14-17, pp. 53-62; - 369.

Xenophon in his Hellenica and the anonymous author of the Hellenica Oxyrhynchia describe the outbreak of the Corinthian war, but their opinions diverge radically about responsabilities. The comparison of the two narratives shows that the anonymous author wrote before Xenophon who reacted to his version of facts changing the chronological orders of events significantly to exalt Agesilaus’s deeds in Asia Minor diverging from both the anonymous author and Spartan propaganda. - Avec résumé en anglais.
